About Me

Saludos! My name is Danton Noriega-Goodwin. I’m a Data Scientist at Apple working on modeling global iCloud infrastructure and services demand.

I earned my PhD in Public Policy (economics concentration) from Duke University in August 2019. The title of my dissertation is “Doubled SNAP Dollars and Nudges: An Analysis of Two Pilot Programs Aimed at Increasing the Purchase of Healthy Foods”. I also have a BS in Applied Math from the University of California-Irvine, an MS in Applied Statistics from California State University–Long Beach, and an MA in Economics from Georgetown.

When I’m not working or programming, I’m thinking about ultimate, training for ultimate, or playing ultimate – especially beach ultimate and goaltimate.
